definition: to make way (for sth)
to yield/to permit/to let sb do sth/to have sb do sth/to make sb (feel sad etc)/by (indicates the agent in a passive clause, like 被[bei4])
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu

sentences.english: No problem is permanent storms always give way to the sun.
sentences.chinese: 風暴總會給陽光讓路，寒冬總會轉變爲暖春。

sentences.english: If the car does not yield to pedestrian, the car could be ticketed.
sentences.chinese: 大多數國家，如果車子不給行人讓路，會被抄罰單的。

sentences.english: Power -driven heavier - than -air aircraft shall give way to gliders.
sentences.chinese: 重於空氣的動力驅動飛機應該給滑翔機讓路。

sentences.english: Your project will have to make way, for the main project.
sentences.chinese: 你們的工程得給重點工程讓路。

sentences.english: A fat sow was grubbing about near the gate and refused to move out of our way.
sentences.chinese: 一隻肥母豬在大門口拱來拱去，不肯給我們讓路。

sentences.english: I will never make way for a fool.
sentences.chinese: 我從來不會給一個傻瓜讓路。

sentences.english: When entering a trail or starting a descent, yield to other skiers.
sentences.chinese: 進入滑雪道或開始下滑時，要給其他滑雪者讓路。

sentences.english: Make way, oh, make way for my Eastern Rose.
sentences.chinese: 讓路，哦，請爲我美麗的東方玫瑰讓點路。

sentences.english: Aeroplanes shall give way to power -driven heavier - than -air aircraft.
sentences.chinese: 飛機應該給重於空氣的動力驅動飛機讓路。

sentences.english: Cars have to yield to pedestrians at zebra crossings.
sentences.chinese: 汽車須在斑馬線前停下來讓路予行人。

sentences.english: We did not give way to bitterness.
sentences.chinese: 我們沒有給苦難和怨恨讓路。

sentences.english: Anti-terrorism gave way to its much more potent cousin, anti-insurgency.
sentences.chinese: 反恐讓路給了其更有力的表親，平叛。

sentences.english: An optimization opportunity model is proposed for given-way vessel to take collision avoidance action.
sentences.chinese: 應用多種理論方法建立了讓路船避碰時機優化模型。

sentences.english: Storms always give away to the sun. Winner always thaws into springtime.
sentences.chinese: 風暴總會給陽光讓路，寒冬總會轉變爲暖春。

sentences.english: Matteo Brighi might make way for Simone Perrotta in a more attacking formation.
sentences.chinese: 布里吉可能需要給佩羅塔讓路，使陣容更具攻擊性。

sentences.english: The tears are not just giving ways to joy, they produce joy.
sentences.chinese: 所以，淚水不僅爲喜樂讓路，而且它們將生髮出喜樂。

definition: to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
lit. bashing sideways and colliding straight on (idiom); to push through shoving and bumping/to barge/to charge around violently
hissing sound/to hiss (as a sign of displeasure)
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
monkey (dialect)/little monkey (affectionate term for children, subordinates)
to whine on for days (idiom)/to endlessly grumble complaints/incessant whining
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to plan/to arrange
relay station
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
to turn a blind eye to
to be reluctant to give up a post
variant of 小題大做|小题大做[xiao3 ti2 da4 zuo4]
